title: Zuma faces backlash after sacking finance minister
text:
Zuma faces backlash after sacking South Africa finance minister Late-night cabinet purge sends rand sharply lower on fears of turmoil in fragile economy Read next updated Friday, 31 March, 2017 South African finance minister Pravin Gordhan, left, talks to President Jacob Zuma, who is coming under pressure © Reuters by: Joseph Cotterill in Johannesburg 
President Jacob Zuma faced a growing backlash after his decision to sack Pravin Gordhan, his finance minister, and eight other cabinet members rocked South Africa’s markets and threatened the biggest crisis yet for the ruling African National Congress under his leadership. 
Mr Zuma’s move to fire Mr Gordhan as part of a late-night cabinet reshuffle sent the rand down as much as 2.6 per cent on Friday, taking the currency’s decline this week to more than 7 per cent — its worst fall since late 2015. Bank shares on the Johannesburg Stock Exchange plummeted 4.5 per cent. This is the end of your free article preview. Want to continue reading?
